main event: On November 25, 1954, observers in the New Orleans area reported seeing a group of 7 moving objects that appeared to glow in green, white, blue, and amber colors.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 33 minutes., The objects were observed using ground visual methods, air intercept radar, and ground radar., There were multiple evaluations suggesting the objects could be balloons, aircraft, or astronomical bodies., The reporting officer concluded that the objects were positively identified as stars., The objects were seen in groups of 2.
